snippet: Speaking for the first time since his election victory, Hassan Rowhani called Iran’s nonexistent ties with the United States a “wound” that must be healed.
abstract: Iran's President-elect Hassan Rouhani, in first news conference since his election victory, says he wants to reduce tensions with the United States but rules out direct talks between the two estranged nations.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Speaking for the first time since his election victory, Hassan Rowhani called Iran’s nonexistent ties with the United States a “wound” that must be healed.

headline.main: Iran President-Elect Wants to Ease Strains With U.S., but Sees No Direct Talks
headline.print_headline: Iran President-Elect Wants to Ease Strains With U.S., but Sees No Direct Talks
